meanings.definition: Tending to make one feel sleepy or drowsy.
meanings.sent1: The warm, cozy blanket made me feel snoozy.
meanings.sent2: After a big meal, I always feel a bit snoozy.
meanings.sent3: The boring lecture was so snoozy that even the teacher started yawning.
meanings.sent4: The slow, steady rain had a snoozy effect on the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The gentle lullaby had a wonderfully snoozy melody.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a feeling of sleepiness or drowsiness.
meanings.sent1: The lazy Sunday afternoon was so snoozy that I napped for hours.
meanings.sent2: The snoozy cat stretched out in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent3: The snoozy atmosphere of the library made it the perfect place for a quiet nap.
meanings.sent4: The snoozy haze of the hot summer day made everything feel slow and dreamy.
meanings.sent5: The snoozy feeling after a long day's work was a welcome relief.
